properties.headline: High Wind Watch issued January 11 at 11:48AM PST until January 14 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...Adjusted wind wording for rest of today. Added high
wind watch for Monday night and Tuesday.

* WHAT...For the Wind Advisory today, west winds 15 to 25 mph with
gusts up to 50 mph. For the High Wind Watch, southwest winds 30
to 40 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible along Highway 395
near canyon openings.

* WHERE...Mono County including Antelope Valley, Bridgeport, Lee
Vining, Mammoth Lakes.

* WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 4 PM PST this afternoon.
For the High Wind Watch, from Monday evening through Tuesday
morning.

* IMPACTS...For today travel will be difficult for high profile
vehicles through the Eastern Sierra including along Highway 395.
For Monday night and Tuesday, damaging winds could blow down
trees, fences, and power lines. Power outages are possible.
Travel could be hazardous, especially for high profile vehicles.
Severe turbulence for aviation.
properties.instruction:
Secure loose outdoor items such as patio furniture, holiday
decorations (if they were not blown away by last nights winds),
and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items
away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by making sure
you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare
batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING
